mainEntity.name: What is a trade licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: A trade license is a legal document that permits an individual or a business to engage in a specific trade, business, or commercial activity within a particular geographic area. It is issued by the local municipal corporation or the concerned authority, depending on the regulations of the region.

mainEntity.name: Why is there a trade licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: A trade license is mandatory for businesses to comply with regulations, operate legally, generate revenue, and ensure safety standards. It helps prevent tax evasion and illegal practices and identifies unregistered businesses.

mainEntity.name: Who can issue a trade licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: A trade license can be issued by the municipality corporation licensing department and the state government.

mainEntity.name: Is there any categories in trade licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, trade licenses are categorized based on risk levels. They include low-risk-based license, medium-risk-based license, and high-risk-based license.

mainEntity.name: What are the documents required to apply?

acceptedAnswer.text: The documents required to apply for a trade license include Aadhar card/PAN card and a rental/leasing agreement that mentions the necessary information.

mainEntity.name: What is the procedure for applying?

acceptedAnswer.text: The procedure for applying for a trade license involves visiting the online portal, filling out the online application with the required information, verifying the documents and application form, and tracking the application status.

mainEntity.name: How long would it take to get the business licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: It usually takes around 12 days from the submission of the application to receive the business license. For updates on your application, you can consult with our 3g consultants.

mainEntity.name: What are the legal consequences of not following the rules and regulations?

acceptedAnswer.text: If you don't follow the rules for obtaining and maintaining a trade license, you may face penalties of up to 50% of the license cost. To avoid such consequences, ensure compliance with all applicable rules and regulations.

mainEntity.name: When should I renew my licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: You should renew your license before one week prior to the expiry date.

mainEntity.name: Is trade licence required for a private limited company?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, a trade license is required to commence the business for a private limited company.

mainEntity.name: Types of companies that require a trade licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: Companies that require a trade license can be of various types, including general trade license, professional trade license, industrial trade license, tourism trade license, liquor trade license, food trade license, health trade license, and entertainment trade license.

mainEntity.name: Is a trade licence mandatory for GST registration?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, a trade license is not necessary for registration under GST.

mainEntity.name: Is a trade licence valid all over India?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, a trade license is valid across cities in India to regulate business activities.

mainEntity.name: Is a trade licence mandatory in India?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, a trade license is mandatory for anyone who wants to engage in any business.

mainEntity.name: What are the requirements for a trade licence?

acceptedAnswer.text: To obtain a trade license, the applicant must be at least 18 years old and should not have any criminal record.
